pullRequest.title: Export UCT - change of status
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
 Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Does this PR already have an issue describing the problem ? If so, link to this issue using '#XXX' and skip the rest
What kind of change does this PR introduce? (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)
BugFix
What is the current behavior? (You can also link to an open issue here)
In the exported CGM, the status of all the tie-lines are changed from 0 = real element to 1 = equivalent element.
This is also a problem for all X-nodes, which are changed from real to equivalent node status
In also happens on the other way round: internal equivalent lines become real ones after the merging.
What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?
Keeping Ucte element statut as property in import then use it in export.
For DanglingLines we keep both UcteNodeStatus and UcteElementStatus.
For XNode Creation in export if there is any incoherence between the two network, we use UcteNodeStatus.REAL as default value.
Example:
network1:
##ZXX
XXXXXX11 XNODE 1      0 0        3.96708 0.00000 0.00000 0.00000
network2:
##ZXX
XXXXXX11              1 0        3.96708 0.00000 0.00000 0.00000
Merged network will be:
##ZXX
XXXXXX11 XNODE 1      0 0        0.00000 0.00000 0.00000 0.00000
Does this PR introduce a breaking change or deprecate an API? If yes, check the following:

 The Breaking Change or Deprecated label has been added
 The migration guide has been updated in the github wiki (What changes might users need to make in their application due to this PR?)

Other information:
(if any of the questions/checkboxes don't apply, please delete them entirely)

commit.message:
New implementation for element statuses in Ucte I/O

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Murgey <sebastien.murgey@rte-france.com>

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if we should override getDelegate() to return a TieLine and avoid casting everywhere

commit.message:
Increase coverage and fix some sonar smells
